cells.data:
Bases

Algorithm to divide $n$ by $b$ with remainder
$n = q_0 b + a_0$
If $q_0 \lt b$
    halt ($n = q_0 + a_0$)
If $q_0 \geq b$
    divide $q$ by $b$ with remainder
    ($q_0 = q_1 b + a_1$)
    $n = (q_1 b + a_1)b + a_0 = q_1 b^2 + a_1b + a_0$
    
Induction: Assume we know the theorem for $1,2, \dots, n-1$ and we want to prove it for $n$

Prime numbers
$p$ is prime if
$\forall b \geq 1 : b \mid p \implies (b = 1) \lor (b = p)$

Non-primes are composite numbers

The fundamental theorem of arithmetic: every integer greater than 1 can be written uniquely as a prime or a product of two or more primes (where the prime factorization is written in order of non-decreasing terms).

Decide whether a number is prime or not
Check (primes) up to $\sqrt{n}$ to see if they divide $n$
